item.title: Carol add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I felt my lungs inflate with the onrush of scenery—air, mountains, trees, people. I thought, "This is what it is to be happy." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Carol add a quote by Elizabeth Wurtzel
item.description: "That's the thing about depression: A human being can survive almost anything, as long as she sees the end in sight. But depression is so insidious, and it compounds daily, that it's impossible to ever see the end." -- Elizabeth Wurtzel

item.title: Carol add a quote by John Green
item.description: "still, what could i say? that i didn't just feel depressed - instead, it was like the depression was the core of me, of every part of me, from my mind to my bones? that if he got blue, i got black? that i hated those pills so much, because i knew how much i relied on them to live?" -- John Green

item.title: Carol add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "So, this is my life. And I want you to know that I am both happy and sad and I'm still trying to figure out how that could be." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Carol add a quote by Frank Portman
item.description: "Normal: lacking in taste, compassion, understanding, kindness, and ordinary human decency." -- Frank Portman

item.title: Carol add a quote by Ned Vizzini
item.description: "I didn't want to wake up. I was having a much better time asleep. And that's really sad. It was almost like a reverse nightmare, like when you wake up from a nightmare you're so relieved. I woke up into a nightmare." -- Ned Vizzini

item.title: Carol add a quote by Adam Rapp
item.description: "I don't mind him not talking so much, because you can hear his voice in your heart; the same way you can hear a song in your head even if there isn't a radio playing; the same way you can hear those blackbirds flying when they're not in the sky" -- Adam Rapp

item.title: Carol add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
